chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Vicich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Straight-Time.
-Sentence credit of 60 days is granted. TIME SERVED.

-To be paid as a condition of probation on 20CF1047 and 21CF1940. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

-Cases 22CF812, 22CF998, and 22CF999 are dismissed and read-in.

records.addlTxt:
Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty. Daniel Murray
**Clerk inboxed to BC on 09-15-2022.**

3:50 PM Defendant Nicholas A Vicich in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel P. Murray in court for Nicholas A Vicich.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

State gives recitation of plea negotiations. Court clarifies with parties, as plea questionnaire/waiver of rights form indicated. 
Parties confirm that:
DE will plead guilty to: 
Sole count in 20CF1047;
Count #1 in 21CF1940;
Count #2 in 22CF1000.
Counts and Cases that will be dismissed and read-in:
Count #2 of 21CF1940;
22CF812;
22CF998;
22CF999;
Counts #1 and #3 of 22CF1000.

AS IT RELATES TO 21CF1940 AND 22CF1000: Information filed, reading waived. Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Court conducts colloquy re: preliminary hearing waiver. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #2. Court conducts colloquy and finds the Defendant guilty of count #2. Counts #1 and #3 are dismissed and read-in. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments. Defense requests expunction. Defendant makes statements.  

Court orders the following:

COUNT #2:

Court orders the following:	
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail, Straight-time.
60 Days Credit.
TIME SERVED. 

Costs:  $268.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a condition of probation on 20CF1047 and 21CF1940.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 23, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

04:02 PM Defendant Nicholas A Vicich in court, in custody, with attorney Daniel P. Murray.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

State places offer on the record. 
Atty Murray states that his understanding was different that the offer recited by the State on the record. 
New plea/sentencing hearing set for Atty Murray to speak to charging attorney. 

Court will set another plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

File not called on the record.

Attorney Daniel P. Murray in court.   Defendant Nicholas A Vicich did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Murray requests to reset the plea/sentencing hearing, as this morning he received a final offer from the State, and he has been unable to review with his client.   Court sets.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas A Vicich
Current: 515 West Moreland Blvd., C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-17-2022)
Prior: 1128 Mallard Ct, Mukwonago, WI 53149

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  
Comply with all licensing restrictions.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Nicholas A Vicich in court, in custody, with attorney Daniel P. Murray.    
Court will continue the appointment of Attorney Murray to include cases:  22CF998, 22CF999 and 22CF1000

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  

State presented their bail arguments.
Defense presented their bail arguments.

Court sets a cash bail in the amount of $200
CONDITIONS:
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

Defense waives time limits.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
